example.eg: The falling chair left a mark on the wall.
example.egtrans: 椅子掉下来，在墙上留下了痕迹。

example.eg: The antique table has a dark mark towards the left side.
example.egtrans: 那张古香古色的桌子左侧有一处暗色的痕迹。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 痕迹, 印迹, 污痕

example.eg: You need to put a punctuation mark at the end of every sentence.
example.egtrans: 你得在每个句子的结尾打上标点符号。

example.eg: He received a low mark in Spanish.
example.egtrans: 他西班牙语的分数很低。

example.eg: Mark the text to be studied.
example.egtrans: 把要学习的内容做上标记。

example.eg: The cat marked the table leg with its claws.
example.egtrans: 猫用爪子把桌子脚抓得伤痕累累。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 弄污，刮花, 使有斑点

example.eg: The teacher marked the students' essays with the scores they had earned.
example.egtrans: 老师给学生的作文打出了应得的分数。

example.eg: I need your signature or mark at the bottom.
example.egtrans: 我需要你在底部签字或者十字画押。

example.eg: The rising sun is the mark for that brand of floor wax.
example.egtrans: 那个地板蜡品牌的商标图案就是个上升的太阳。

example.eg: This gift is a mark of my respect for you.
He hit the mark on his third shot with the bow and arrow.
example.egtrans: 他第三次射箭，击中了目标。

example.eg: St Paul's Cathedral is the most obvious mark in this area of London.
example.egtrans: 圣保罗大教堂是伦敦地区最明显的地标。

example.eg: The four-minute mile is the mark that all middle distance runners want to beat.
example.egtrans: 四分钟一英里的标准是所有中长跑运动员都想超越的。

example.eg: The pickpocket looked for a new mark with a full wallet.
example.egtrans: 小偷正寻找有钱的新目标下手。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 被欺骗的对象，容易受骗的人, 下手对象，攻击对象

example.eg: There are four marks along the trail.
example.egtrans: 这路上有四个参照点。

example.eg: The mark to beat is three point two metres.
The players tallied the marks on the scorecard.
example.egtrans: 球员们把计分板上的分数记录下来。

example.eg: They realized that the letter was genuine when they saw the prince's mark.
example.egtrans: 他们看到王子的印章时，意识到这封信并非伪造。

example.eg: His involvement in the project is a mark of real quality.
example.egtrans: 这个项目有他参加，必出优品。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 迹象, 标志, 表示

example.eg: Violence marked each night of the war.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 作为…的标志, 是...的特征

example.eg: She marked her ballot paper with a cross.
The store marked the goods on sale with red price tags.
He marked her displeasure and responded appropriately.
The country's first democratic election marks the start of a new era.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 标志着…，是…的迹象，是…的征兆

example.eg: The teacher marked my paper down because I misspelled so many words.
The store marked down the Christmas merchandise in January.
Mark down your dentist appointment on the calendar so you don't forget it!
Mark off the area to be tiled and find the centre.
Animals mark out their territory with a variety of visual and scent signals.
example.egtrans: 动物会用视觉和嗅觉信号划出自己的领地。

example.eg: Hotels mark up their prices whenever there is a national holiday.
example.egtrans: 每到全国性假期，酒店的价格就会上涨。

example.eg: Please mark up your document to indicate bold, italic, or underlined.
One of the the most famous beauty marks is the one that Marilyn Monroe had on her left cheek.
example.egtrans: 最有名的美人痣之一便是梦露左脸上的那颗痣。

example.eg: Start the measurement at the benchmark on the stone post at the edge of the field.
example.egtrans: 从场地边缘的石柱的基准点开始测量。

example.eg: By the end of the school year, all third-grade students will need to meet this benchmark.
example.egtrans: 学年结束时，所有三年级学生都必须满足这个标准。

example.eg: This restaurant is the benchmark against which I measure all other restaurants.
example.egtrans: 这家餐厅是我衡量所有其他餐厅的标杆。

example.eg: She is really self-conscious about the birth mark on her neck.
The scandal was a black mark on the politician's career.

dsense.name: Bless the mark, God bless the mark, God save the mark, Heaven save the mark
dsense.guideword: archaic (expression of contempt) (表示嘲笑、讥讽)

dsense.name: Bless the mark, God bless the mark, God save the mark, Heaven save the mark

example.eg: This man is the very devil, bless the mark!

dsense.name: check mark, checkmark
dsense.guideword: US (tick: list item, correct answer, etc.)

example.eg: He wrote a check mark next to each completed task on his list.
The crop marks show the exact size of the page.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 作物标记, 作物痕迹

example.eg: She was an elderly lady who lived alone: an easy mark for the con-man.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 容易受骗的人, 容易遭利用的人

example.eg: It is considered poor style to use too many exclamation points when writing.
I got a very good mark in my Spanish exam.

dsense.name: hash mark, hash symbol, hash sign

example.eg: To abbreviate the word "number" in English, just use the hash mark.
The high-water mark is easy to identify on a beach by a line of debris such as seaweed.
The end of the second century was the high-water mark of the Roman Empire.
All meat products must have an identification mark to show where they come from.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 识别标记（如条码、序列号等）

example.eg: The index mark indicates the starting point of a track on a hard drive.
The Kitemark shows consumers that a product conforms to the appropriate British Standard.
Parents leave their mark on their children.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 打下烙印, 留下影响

example.eg: He made a mark on the pavement to show where to turn.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在…上留下记号, 在…上作标记

example.eg: Dick Button made his mark on figure skating when he performed the first double axel jump.
Peter Jackson has made his mark in the cinematic realm.
Entries marked as "private" are not visible to other users.

dsense.name: mark my words, you mark my words

example.eg: Mark my words! That boy will always be a troublemaker.
The teacher gave us the mark scheme so we could mark the paper ourselves.
The lighting of the torch marks the beginning of the Olympic Games.
In the year 2000, there were celebrations around the world to mark the beginning of the new millennium.
Let us mark the occasion by opening a bottle of champagne.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 庆祝这件事，纪念这一刻

example.eg: The children had marked up the walls with crayon.
The dealer added a 5% markup to the car.
Lindsay printed the final document without markups.
The essay misses the mark because it doesn't directly answer the question.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 未达到目的, 未实现目标

example.eg: The soccer player's shot missed the mark and went out for a goal kick.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 未击中目标, 偏离目标

dsense.name: on your mark, on your marks, take your mark, take your marks
dsense.guideword: (sport: take up starting position) (体育比赛)

example.eg: On your marks; get set; go!
Don't forget to end your sentence with a punctuation mark.
A written sentence that is a question must end with a question mark.
There's a question mark over his ability to manage the team.

dsense.name: quick on the draw, quick on the trigger, quick off the mark
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (quick to act or react)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抢先行动, 占取先机

dsense.name: quotation mark, speech mark
dsense.guideword: usually plural (punctuation indicating speech, etc.) (标点符号)

example.eg: Should quotation marks come before or after a full stop?
Students must follow the university's style rules when including reference marks in their essays.
There was a black scuff on the white floor tile.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 磨损处, 磨损痕迹, 蹭痕

example.eg: The service mark appears on the uniforms of the company's employees.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 妊娠纹, 皮肤扩张纹

example.eg: My teacher told me that my work wasn't up to the mark.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 符合要求的, 达到标准的

example.eg: The flood had left a watermark on the wall.

dsense.name: wide, wide of the target, wide of the mark

example.eg: The shot was wide of the target.
example.egtrans: 这一击离靶子很远。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 远离目标的, 偏离目标的, 偏差得远的

example.eg: Catherine tried to guess the price of the watch, but she was wide of the mark.
The archer's first shot at the target was wide of the mark.
